results.title: The Way things go
results.brief_description: Inside a warehouse, artists Peter Fischli and David Weiss build an enormous, precarious structure 100 feet long made out of common household items - tea kettles, tires, old shoes, balloons, wooden ramps, etc. Then, with fire, water, gravity, and chemistry, they create a spectacular chain reaction, a self destructing performance of physical interactions, chemical reactions, and precisely-crafted chaos worthy of Rube Goldberg or Alfred Hitchcock.

results.brief_description: Depicts farming methods, irrigation programs, family life, and division of labour in an Egyptian village. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Way of the world
results.brief_description: Silent film exploring religious themes about a priest who ventures out into the streets amongst the workers to spread the word of god. Cast includes Henry B. Walthall, George Nichols, Florence Barker, Gertrude Claire.

results.title: The Way of the dragon = Return of the dragon
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Raymond Chow and Bruce Lee
results.brief_description: Tang Lung travels to Rome to help save a family friend’s restaurant which is being threatened by a powerful gang boss. Initially seen as an embarrassment amongst his Chinese friends, Tang Lung is soon held in high esteem when he reveals his masterful martial arts skills defending the restaurant against the thugs. The gang boss begins a number of attacks on the restaurant in an effort to defeat Tang Lung. He finally flies in an American martial arts assassin to challenge Tang Lung to fight to the death. Cast includes: Bruce Lee, Nora Miao and Chuck Norris. Dubbed into English.

results.title: The Way of the dinosaur
results.brief_description: Animated parable equating the extinction of the dinosaur with the possible extinction of the human race, the parallel being that the dinosaurs couldn’t adapt to change and that the human use of non-renewable fossil fuels might see us going the same way.
results.description: Animated parable equating the extinction of the dinosaur with the possible extinction of the human race, the parallel being that the dinosaurs couldn’t adapt to change and that the human use of non-renewable fossil fuels might see us going the same way.

results.title: The Way of the ancestors
results.creator_credit: BBC, Peter Montagnon and Malcolm Feuerstein
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Long Search”.
In this program the producers have chosen the Turaja people of Sulawesi in Indonesia to represent cultures which still practice a ‘primal’ religion. Their particular form of religion emphasises the role of the ancestors which leads to extremely elaborate and lengthy funeral ceremonies with an emphasis on animal sacrifice. Ronald Eyre ponders on how these religions are coping with the modern world, in the form of christianity and ‘cultural tourism’, as well as trying to understand the religion itself. The film does contain scenes of animal sacrifice, although the viewer is warned of their approach.

results.title: The Way of a river
results.brief_description: This film follows the River Test, Hampshire, from its source to its mouth in Southampton Water. It is a clear, swift-flowing trout stream, completely unmpolluted, despite factories on its lower reaches. Underwater sequences of trout spawning and a fish’s eyeview of the angler are shown.

results.title: The Way it is
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Diane Beaudry and Beverly Shaffer
results.brief_description: This sensitive drama examines the effects of divorce on a family, particularly on a twelve-year-old girl. Although Helen Murray’s parents were divorced two years ago, Helen still hopes for a reconciliation. When a visit from her father is cancelled, an emotionally charged confrontation with her mother takes place. Helen admits her anguish over the divorce and realizes that she must learn to accept the situation. An excellent film for both children and adults on the themes of family communications and coping positively with family break-up, The Way It Is can be used for discussion in family-life courses and single-parent groups, and for individual and couples counselling. Cast: Stephanie Daniel, Anick Farris, Kevin Riley, Ronna Sinclair, Shauna Wilkie

results.title: The Way I see it
results.creator_credit: Roundtable Productions, Leon S. Gold and Jack Denove
results.brief_description: A case study which explores the effect of perceptual differences on supervisor-subordinate relations and on job performance. Looking critically and objectively at both sides the roots of the differences are seen as perceptual. The problem is not resolved.
